results.title: Communities keep clean
results.brief_description: Compares community cleaning to house cleaning and includes scenes of street cleaning, water purification, park upkeep, landfill projects and air apollution control. Emphasizes that community upkeep is a shared responsibility.

results.title: Communities depend on each other
results.brief_description: Descibes how communities depend on each other for goods and services such as food, clothing, appliances, magazines, automobiles and fuel. Explains the role of transportation and communication.

results.title: Communism
results.brief_description: An example of a propaganda film made in the United States in the early 1950’s informing the viewer of the evils of communism and how to detect those with communist beliefs. Includes historical footage.

results.title: Communism
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and David A. Smart
results.brief_description: Traces the origin and development of Communism, covering the early doctrines of Karl Marx, the roles of Lenin, Trotsky and Stalin and the more recent growth international Communism. Shows how the Western nations are combating the spread of Communism in under-developed countries by supplying food, clothing and industrial machinery and by forming military defence alliances. Typical of Cold War propaganda films in the 50’s, attempts to justify US defence strategies and spending.

results.title: Communication: getting it going
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and George Cass
results.brief_description: This program shows some of the ways the theme communication can be developed in primary and postprimary English programs. The English framework encourages these ideas as a means of extending and enriching the experiences of all students.

results.title: Communication: getting in touch
results.creator_credit: Bosustow Entertainment, Nick Bosustow and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: An alien colony settles on earth and language differences present a problem. This film shows in a humorous way how communicating with others involves getting in touch with their ways of exchanging information; and how to overcome the three barriers to communication: linguistic, sociological and personal. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
